slides.text: MCP-UI literally sent a fruit basket coded in TypeScript to woo Ruben—he forked it and merged himself into their team.
During negotiations, Ruben demanded dark mode in every conference room; MCP-UI responded by turning the entire campus’ lights off until he signed.
His onboarding involved a code review with a sentient AI who only speaks in GIFs—Ruben nodded, pretended to understand, and deployed to prod.
Sources say Ruben is already planning a refactor of MCP-UI’s coffee machine firmware to add CI/CD (Coffee Integration/Continuous Drip).
